title: AB 1175
content: The people of the State of California enact the following. Section 9873 of the Business and Professions Code is amended to set fees for electronic and appliance repair industry service dealers and service contractors. The initial registration fee is not more than $205 for each place of business for electronic and appliance repair industry service dealers, and not more than $95 for service contractors. The initial registration fees for electronic and appliance repair industry service dealers and service contractors are set as follows: $405 for dealers in both industries, $300 for dealers in one industry, and $500 for dealers who are also service contractors. The registration fee for individuals engaging in both electronic and appliance repair industries as service dealers and contractors is a maximum of $500 per place of business in the state. Those not operating a business in the state but involved in these industries or selling service contracts must pay the same fee as if they had a business in the state. The annual registration renewal fees for electronic and appliance repair industry service dealers and contractors vary based on the type of business and services provided. The fees range from $95 to $475 per place of business in the state, with a maximum fee of $500 for those engaging in both industries as service dealers and contractors. The annual renewal fee for service dealers in the electronic and appliance repair industry is up to $475 per place of business in the state. A delinquency fee of 50% of the renewal fee applies. This section is in effect until January 1, 2019, unless extended by a later statute. Section 9873 of the Business and Professions Code sets fees for service dealers in the electronic and appliance repair industry. The director can adjust fees through regulation until January 1, 2017. This section will be repealed on January 1, 2019, unless extended by a later statute. Section 9873 of the Business and Professions Code sets fees for electronic and appliance repair industry service dealers. The director can adjust fees through regulation. The initial registration fee for a service dealer is not more than $205 for each place of business in the state, or $405 for those engaging in both electronic and appliance repair services. The annual registration renewal fee for electronic and appliance repair industry service dealers is $205 per place of business if renewed before expiration. For dealers in both industries, the fee is $400. A delinquency fee of 50% of the renewal fee applies. Effective January 1, 2019. The fee for various licenses under the Business and Professions Code will be set by the chief, with approval from the director, ranging from $20 to $940. Effective January 1, 2019. Individuals making pillows, quilts, etc. at home are exempt from fees. Retailers selling "used" and "antique" furniture are also exempt. Retailers selling "used" and "antique" furniture are exempt from fee requirements and other provisions of the chapter. Those selling upholstered furniture for physical fitness must comply with fee requirements. Individuals with required fee and licensed as furniture manufacturers or custom upholsterers do not need to pay for a sanitizer's license.
